An overtone in the award is a sense, which prevails both in professional athletics and in American society, that the natural response to unequal racial treatment in courts should be to stick it to the man and redefine justice by the terms of the minority group. . On February 12, the NBA scoring leader had a league season-high 46 points in a 98-94 loss to the San Antonio Spurs. "When I score 40 points, we've lost," Allen Iverson said. Tonight, we won, and I guess I finally got the monkey off my back. I didn't know what I had until I came out of the game at the end and looked up at the scoreboard. I saw what I had and said,` I hope it doesn't come back to haunt me.' Working primarily against Philadelphia native Kobe Bryant , Allen Iverson shot 17-of-36 from the field. Early leaks of the book's defiant take on his life, times, and conduct of the Iraq War drew howls from some of the targets of his score-settling-notably John McCain , who proclaimed Thank God he was relieved of his duties. But Donald Rumsfeld battles on, taking his unapologetic account to the public in an interview with Newsweek's John Barry .
